business.headline: Buying home this festive season? Top things to check before Griha PraveshaFamilies often see this period as the most auspicious time to make a big investment like a home, but experts warn that it is also the stage when due diligence becomes most important.

Nirav Modi's brother-in-law Maiank Mehta pardoned in Rs 13,000 crore PNB scam caseA special CBI court granted pardon to Maiank Mehta, brother-in-law of fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi, in the Rs 13,000 crore Punjab National Bank fraud case.

What to expect from the National Stock Exchange in the next 5 years?Ashish Chauhan, CEO of NSE Chauhan, said the rise in investors and market size over the last decade gives a clear idea of the potential ahead. In 2014, India had just 1.67 crore unique investors. Today, there are about 12 crore investors.

50% tariffs and growth: Why India must focus on reform, not retaliationAt the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, experts called for reforms, investment-led growth, and targeted support for vulnerable sectors to navigate challenges from steep US tariffs.

Explained: Why Dalal Street has an edge over global stock marketsAt the India Today Conclave in Mumbai, Ashish Chauhan, CEO of the National Stock Exchange of India (NSE), explained why India's markets and economy hold a stronger position for the future compared to others.

From 50% tariffs to growth: Why India needs reforms, not retaliationAs the US slaps steep tariffs on Indian goods, the debate is shifting from retaliation to reform. Experts at the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025 say India should use this moment to push for deeper reforms that fuel investment and boost domestic demand.
How to invest in pharma and IT stocks during current slowdownWith the US announcing fresh tariffs on branded drugs and uncertainty around H-1B visa rules, both sectors are experiencing headwinds.

India-US trade talks advance amid tariff and energy discussionsIndia-US trade discussions are gaining momentum, with both nations exploring ways to enhance economic cooperation, address tariffs, and boost energy trade.

Sensex tumbles 733 points as pharma, IT stocks hitThe sell-off came after the United States announced a steep 100% tariff on imports of branded and patented pharmaceutical products, effective October 1.

Indian air passengers rise to 131.7 lakh in August 2025 amid rising costs: ReportIndia's aviation sector is bouncing back, but the journey isn't without turbulence. Rising fuel costs, operational challenges, and financial pressures are testing airlines, even as passenger traffic shows steady growth.

Sensex tanks 800 points: Why is stock market falling today?By 2:37 pm, the S&P BSE Sensex had lost 782.71 points to trade at 80,376.97, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 247.10 points to 24,643.75. Both indices were on track to end the week in negative territory.

Investors brace for IPO wave as 18 public listings hit Dalal Street next weekThe four mainboard IPOs opening next week together aim to raise over Rs 850 crore. Apart from them, 14 SME IPOs will also open for bidding next week.

entertainment.headline: Awez Darbar gets evicted from Bigg Boss 19 Digital influencer Awez Darbar has been evicted from 'Bigg Boss 19'. He, along with Pranit More, Ashnoor Kaur, Gaurav Khanna, Neelam Giri and Mridul Tiwari, were nominated for eviction this week.

8-year-old TV actor Veer Sharma, brother die in apartment fire in Rajasthan's Kota A sudden fire broke out in a flat in Kota's Transport Nagar area on Sunday, claiming the lives of two children -- eight-year-old television actor Veer Sharma and his 16-year-old brother, Shoriya Sharma.

Ranbir Kapoor cuts huge cake on 43rd birthday, greets paps; video goes viral Ranbir Kapoor celebrated his 43rd birthday with fans, family, and the media, stepping out to cut a cake with paparazzi and receiving warm wishes from Neetu Kapoor and Soni Razdan. A rare video message from the actor, featuring his daughter Raha's voice in the background, added a special touch to the celebrations.

Pawan Kalyan's They Call Him OG reaches Rs 200 crore globally: Trade report They Call Him OG is Power Star Pawan Kalyan's first film to cross the 200-crore mark at the box office worldwide, and the film has done so in three days according to trade report

My Queen, My Precious: Ali Fazal shares loved-up post for wife Richa Chadha Ali Fazal wrote a sweet note for wife Richa Chadha on Instagram, calling her "My Queen, My Precious", leaving the actor touched.

Gauahar Khan, Zaid Darbar share first glimpse of their second son, reveal name Gauahar Khan and Zaid Darbar have named their newborn son Farwaan, nearly a month after his birth on September 1. The actor shared the announcement with a sweet photo of her elder son Zehaan introducing his little brother.

Ektaa Kapoor says entourage is killing films, calls censor much-needed trouble Ektaa Kapoor, the queen of Indian TV, discussed women breaking industry norms, challenges like censor rules and entourage costs, and affirms TV's strength in the digital era as she readies the new season of 'Naagin'.

PM Modi pays tributes to Lata Mangeshkar and Zubeen Garg in Mann Ki Baat PM Modi paid an emotional tribute to playback legend Lata Mangeshkar on her birthday on Sunday, and hailed late singer Zubeen Garg during his radio show, Mann Ki Baat

120 Bahadur teaser out as special tribute on Lata Mangeshkar's birth anniversary To mark Lata Mangeshkar's birth anniversary, the makers of '120 Bahadur' released a poignant teaser featuring her iconic song 'Ae Mere Watan Ke Logon'. The film, set during the Rezang La battle, will release in November.

Ram Charan celebrates 18 years in cinema, Peddi makers release special poster Tollywood star Ram Charan celebrates 18 years in cinema, with his upcoming film 'Peddi' marking the milestone by releasing a special poster. The film, starring Janhvi Kapoor and featuring music by A.R. Rahman, is halfway through production and has already secured a massive OTT deal.

Punjabi singer Rajvir Jawanda hospitalised in critical condition after bike accident Punjabi singer Rajvir Jawanda is in critical condition after a motorcycle accident in Himachal Pradesh, sustaining severe head and spine injuries and requiring ventilator support. Fans, fellow artists, and political leaders have expressed concern and prayed for his speedy recovery.

Nothing comes easy: Ajith Kumar thanks wife Shalini for her silent strength Ahead of his 24H Barcelona race on September 28, actor Ajith Kumar spoke about the delicate balance between family and passion, crediting wife Shalini's unwavering support. The Tamil superstar also spoke about his love for racing.

Homebound box office day 2: Ishaan's film gets lukewarm response with Rs 50 lakh India's Oscar entry 'Homebound', starring Ishaan Khatter, Vishal Jethwa, and Janhvi Kapoor, has seen a muted response at the domestic box office, earning just Rs 80 lakh so far.

They Call Him OG box office day 3: Pawan Kalyan's film crosses Rs 120 crore mark  Pawan Kalyan's 'They Call Him OG' has emerged as a box office hit, earning over Rs 120 crore in India and becoming his highest-grossing film. The action-drama, also starring Emraan Hashmi and Priyanka Mohan, performed strongly despite mixed reviews.

BB19 Weekend Ka Vaar: Salman schools Amaal, Gauahar urges Awez to raise voice This Weekend Ka Vaar of 'Bigg Boss 19' featured Tanya Mittal's birthday celebrations with heated confrontations, sharp remarks, and emotional breakdowns. Salman Khan schooled Amaal and Baseer for their gameplay, with Gauahar Khan urging Awez to raise his voice.

Please get some work: Did Salman Khan take a dig at Abhinav Kashyap? Salman Khan subtly addressed criticism against him after 'Dabangg' director Abhinav Kashyap made negative comments about him in a recent podcast. During a recent 'Bigg Boss 19' episode, Salman urged people to get a job and stop spreading negativity.

Prabhas' The RajaSaab trailer release date and time, all you need to know Pan-India superstar Prabhas fans are excited about his next release, The RajaSaab. The film opens in January 2026 and the buzz is already building, with the trailer all set to be launched.

Ranbir Kapoor gets sweet birthday wishes with throwback pics from Riddhima, Neetu Ranbir Kapoor turned 43 and got sweet birthday wishes from his sister Riddhima Kapoor Sahni and mother Neetu Kapoor, who shared old family photos and messages.

Ranbir Kapoor back in Mumbai with Alia Bhatt, paps shower birthday wishes at airport Actor Ranbir Kapoor was seen with wife Alia Bhatt at the airport on his birthday. He acknowledged warm wishes from the paparazzi, who were stationed at the Mumbai airport on Sunday.

general news.headline: India refuse Asia Cup trophy from PCB chief, celebrate empty-handed on stageAsia Cup 2025 final, Ind vs Pak: In one of the most bizarre scenes in cricket history, the victorious Indian team celebrated without the trophy on the dais in Dubai. Suryakumar Yadav said India were denied the trophy after it emerged that the team refused to collect it from Pakistan Cricket Board chief Mohsin Naqvi.

PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi ran away with Asia Cup trophy, says BCCI secretaryBCCI secretary Devajit Saikia took a sharp dig at PCB head Mohsin Naqvi after the Asia Cup final on Sunday. He said that Naqvi went away to his hotel room with the Asia Cup trophy after India won the title by beating Pakistan.

Op Sindoor on games field: PM Modi celebrates India beating Pak in Asia Cup finalPrime Minister Narendra Modi termed India's five-wicket win over Pakistan in the Asia Cup final as "Operation Sindoor on the games field," saying the outcome remained the same - India wins - as he congratulated the Indian cricketers.

Ind 3-0 Pak. Tilak Varma special inspires India to 9th Asia Cup crownIndia vs Pakistan, Asia Cup 2025 Final: After a riveting display from their spinners, India overcame a top-order collapse to chase down 147 in Dubai. Pakistan paid the price for a reckless batting performance, going down to their arch-rivals for the third successive time in the tournament - including in the game that mattered most.

No trophy, no problem: Surya leads Asia Cup celebration with photoshopped picsIndia stars added a trophy emoticon to their celebration pics to mock Mohsin Naqvi after the PCB chief ran away with the Asia Cup title on Sunday, September 28. The Indian players said they won't accept the trophy from Naqvi at the post-match presentation.

Calls for CBI probe grow as blame game escalates after Karur stampede kills 40 UpdatesTamil Nadu police filed a case against TVK leaders for negligence and launched a forensic probe at multiple sites, including a sewer where two bodies were reportedly found on Sunday.

India disrespected cricket: Pak captain on Asia Cup handshake row, trophy dramaPakistan cricket captain Salman Agha criticised India in the post-match press conference after the Asia Cup final. Agha claimed that India were disrespecting cricket.

4  dead, 8 injured in US church firing incident, Trump calls it 'attack on Christians'The incident took place at the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc, a community located about 50 miles north of Detroit.

Karur disaster was foretold. Vijay's team knew of stampede risk over a year agoA stampede at TVK chief and superstar Vijay's rally in Tamil Nadu's Karur killed 40 people. About 1.5 years ago, Vijay's team members told India Today Digital that getting Thalapathy Vijay to campaign would be a challenge given the fan frenzy surrounding him. They knew of the stampede risk. Even political observers feared it. The real tragedy is that 40 lives were lost despite this awareness. As politician Vijay can't give up campaigning, preparedness will be the key in a country that is prone to crowd surges and stampedes.

TikTok and the Death of Borderless TechThe TikTok saga signals the end of borderless tech. Platforms, AI, and supply chains now align with national priorities, marking a shift from supra-national to geo-national technology governance worldwide.

Need to fix India, stop actions harming US interests: Trump aide's new threatTaking a potshot at India and Brazil, US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said that these countries need to do more to open their markets and stop taking actions that harm US interests.

Watch: Gambhir goes wild, slams table in delight as Tilak whacks Rauf for sixIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir was seen at his ecstatic best as he slammed the table in delight after Tilak Varma's massive six against Haris Rauf in the Asia Cup final against Pakistan.

David Beckham, butter chicken and beyond: The Saransh Goila story on 'Anything But'He grew up vegetarian, fell in love over vegan rajma chawal, and turned butter chicken into a global phenomenon — this is the story of Saransh Goila on 'Anything But', where we talk about everything but their work.

Pak's rock show at White House to seduce TrumpThe White House has released a picture of Donald Trump staring at what it described as rare earth minerals, fixated on Munir's presentation displayed in a neatly arranged wooden box, as Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif looked on with a smile.

Heartbreaking video captures father carrying lifeless child after Karur stampedeHeart-wrenching cries amid the eerie silence of death filled Karur General Hospital on Saturday evening as both the injured and the dead were rushed in from the stampede site at Vijay's political rally. Among the victims were several children. A haunting visual of a grief-stricken father carrying his lifeless child at the hospital stood as a stark testimony to the horror of the evening.

By Sunday evening, the death toll in the stampede now stood at 40 with 10 children.

Ladakh under attack by BJP: Rahul Gandhi backs statehood demand, Sonam WangchukOn September 24, peaceful protests being held under the leadership of activist Songam Wangchuk turned violent as protesters resorted to arson and vandalism by torching the local BJP office and a few vehicles.

Ektaa Kapoor says entourage is killing films, calls censor much-needed troubleEktaa Kapoor, the queen of Indian TV, discussed women breaking industry norms, challenges like censor rules and entourage costs, and affirms TV's strength in the digital era as she readies the new season of 'Naagin'.

No stone-pelting at Vijay's rally, TVK leadership defied our orders: PoliceTamil Nadu police said Vijay's party TVK ignored orders to shift its Karur rally, where 40 people died in a stampede, and dismissed the party's claim that stone-pelting triggered the chaos.

Hotel-hopping, fake PMO link: How molestation-accused Delhi baba evaded copsAccording to Delhi Police sources, the molestation-accused spiritual leader changed locations more than 15 times in an effort to avoid arrest. He strategically checked into hotels near prominent religious sites, knowing these areas attract less scrutiny and would allow him to blend in.

Rajeev Verma appointed Delhi's new Chief Secretary, set to take charge from OctoberRajeev Verma, a 1992-batch IAS officer, has been appointed as the new Chief Secretary of Delhi. He will replace Dharmendra who is set to retire on September 30

Pawan Kalyan's They Call Him OG reaches Rs 200 crore globally: Trade reportThey Call Him OG is Power Star Pawan Kalyan's first film to cross the 200-crore mark at the box office worldwide, and the film has done so in three days according to trade report

Why prediabetes should be treated with same urgency as diabetes in IndiaPrediabetes is becoming a major health challenge in India, especially among young adults. Early screening and preventive treatments like metformin could reduce future diabetes burden.

2 killed, over 11,000 evacuated as heavy rain batters Marathwada; Godavari swellsThe situation worsened after a massive amount of water released from the Jayakwadi dam, the region's largest reservoir, led to rising levels in the Godavari river.
5 dead, 10 critical after bus collides head-on with overloaded car in UPThe accident happened after a UP roadways bus travelling from Lakhimpur to Lucknow rammed into a van coming from Sitapur.

sports.headline: Suryakumar plays down horror run in Asia Cup: Not out of form, just short of runs Suryakumar Yadav dismissed concerns about his form after India's Asia Cup 2025 triumph, stressing he is only short on runs. The skipper remains confident his preparation and leadership will soon translate into match-winning performances with the bat.

No trophy, no problem: Surya leads Asia Cup celebration with photoshopped pics India stars added a trophy emoticon to their celebration pics to mock Mohsin Naqvi after the PCB chief ran away with the Asia Cup title on Sunday, September 28. The Indian players said they won't accept the trophy from Naqvi at the post-match presentation.

Watch: ACC official bolts with Asia Cup trophy after India snub Mohsin Naqvi on stage India vs Pakistan, Asia Cup final: An ACC official was seen rushing away with the Asia Cup trophy on instructions from PCB and ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi, after the Indian team snubbed him from presenting it during the post-match ceremony.

India disrespected cricket: Pak captain on Asia Cup handshake row, trophy drama Pakistan cricket captain Salman Agha criticised India in the post-match press conference after the Asia Cup final. Agha claimed that India were disrespecting cricket.

PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi ran away with Asia Cup trophy, says BCCI secretary BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia took a sharp dig at PCB head Mohsin Naqvi after the Asia Cup final on Sunday. He said that Naqvi went away to his hotel room with the Asia Cup trophy after India won the title by beating Pakistan.

Suryakumar Yadav pledges his entire Asia Cup match fee to Indian army India captain Suryakumar Yadav announced he will donate all Asia Cup 2025 match fees to the Indian Army following their victory over Pakistan. The triumph was overshadowed by India refusing to accept the trophy from Pakistan's interior minister Mohsin Naqvi, creating unprecedented controversy.

Asia Cup champions India were denied trophy: Suryakumar Yadav The Indian team did not lift the winner's trophy after the final of the Asia Cup 2025. Asked what happened, Suryakumar Yadav said that the Indian team were denied the Asia Cup trophy by Asian Cricket Council, the organisers of the tournament.

Watch: India celebrate Asia Cup win without trophy on stage in Dubai Asia Cup champions India on Sunday refused to accept the winners' trophy from ACC chairman Mohsin Naqvi, who is also Pakistan's interior minister and chairman of the country's cricket board. The Indian players celebrated with their fans, posed for photographs, but left the stadium without the trophy, creating a striking image of champions without their silverware.

India refuse Asia Cup trophy from PCB chief, celebrate empty-handed on stage Asia Cup 2025 final, Ind vs Pak: In one of the most bizarre scenes in cricket history, the victorious Indian team celebrated without the trophy on the dais in Dubai. Suryakumar Yadav said India were denied the trophy after it emerged that the team refused to collect it from Pakistan Cricket Board chief Mohsin Naqvi.

Asia Cup: BCCI announces Rs 21 crore cash reward for victorious Indian team The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) declared a cash reward of Rs 21 crore for the Indian squad and support staff after Suryakumar Yadav's men defeated Pakistan by five wickets in a thrilling Asia Cup 2025 final, securing their ninth continental title on Sunday.

Watch: Gambhir goes wild, slams table in delight as Tilak whacks Rauf for six India head coach Gautam Gambhir was seen at his ecstatic best as he slammed the table in delight after Tilak Varma's massive six against Haris Rauf in the Asia Cup final against Pakistan.

Asia Cup champions India were denied trophy: Suryakumar Yadav The Indian team did not lift the winner's trophy after the final of the Asia Cup 2025. Asked what happened, Suryakumar Yadav said that the Indian team were denied the Asia Cup trophy by Asian Cricket Council, the organisers of the tournament.

Watch: India celebrate Asia Cup win without trophy on stage in Dubai Asia Cup champions India on Sunday refused to accept the winners' trophy from ACC chairman Mohsin Naqvi, who is also Pakistan's interior minister and chairman of the country's cricket board. The Indian players celebrated with their fans, posed for photographs, but left the stadium without the trophy, creating a striking image of champions without their silverware.

India refuse Asia Cup trophy from PCB chief, celebrate empty-handed on stage Asia Cup 2025 final, Ind vs Pak: In one of the most bizarre scenes in cricket history, the victorious Indian team celebrated without the trophy on the dais in Dubai. Suryakumar Yadav said India were denied the trophy after it emerged that the team refused to collect it from Pakistan Cricket Board chief Mohsin Naqvi.

Asia Cup: BCCI announces Rs 21 crore cash reward for victorious Indian team The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) declared a cash reward of Rs 21 crore for the Indian squad and support staff after Suryakumar Yadav's men defeated Pakistan by five wickets in a thrilling Asia Cup 2025 final, securing their ninth continental title on Sunday.

Watch: Gambhir goes wild, slams table in delight as Tilak whacks Rauf for six India head coach Gautam Gambhir was seen at his ecstatic best as he slammed the table in delight after Tilak Varma's massive six against Haris Rauf in the Asia Cup final against Pakistan.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
